summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell, denying the defense's motion to prohibit extrajudicial statements by the government and witnesses. The court warns that it will ensure compliance with rules to protect Maxwell's right to a fair trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, whose defense team moved to prohibit extrajudicial statements by the government and witnesses.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge who issued the order denying the defense's motion and warning parties about compliance with court rules.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Maxwell.

events.title: Court denies motion to prohibit extrajudicial statements
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan denies Ghislaine Maxwell's defense motion to prohibit the government and witnesses from making extrajudicial statements about the case.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense moved to prohibit the government and witnesses from making extrajudicial statements about the case.
Judge Alison J. Nathan denied the motion without prejudice, citing the court's expectation of compliance with existing rules.
The court warned that it would take appropriate action if any relevant rules were violated in the future.
The order emphasizes the court's commitment to ensuring Maxwell's right to a fair trial by an impartial jury.
